extendedIngredients.name: apple cider vinegar
extendedIngredients.original: 2 Tbsps sherry or apple cider vinegar

extendedIngredients.name: goat cheese
extendedIngredients.original: 3 ozs fresh goat cheese or feta, crumbled
extendedIngredients.originalName: fresh goat cheese or feta, crumbled

extendedIngredients.name: pears

extendedIngredients.originalName: ripe pears, cored and cut into 1/2" cubes

extendedIngredients.name: pistachios
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup pistachios, toasted and coarsely chopped

extendedIngredients.name: romaine
extendedIngredients.original: 4 cups romaine, torn into bite-sized pieces

extendedIngredients.name: shallot
extendedIngredients.original: 1 large shallot, halved and thinly sliced

title: Arugula, Pear And Goat Cheese Salad With Pomegranate Vinaigrette
summary: Arugula, Pear And Goat Cheese Salad With Pomegranate Vinaigrette might be just the side dish you are searching for. This gluten free and vegetarian recipe serves 6 and costs $1.39 per serving. One serving contains 236 calories, 5g of protein, and 18g of fat. 102 people found this recipe to be delicious and satisfying. If you have apple cider vinegar, shallot, pepper, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 82%. This score is amazing. Similar recipes include Crispy Goat Cheese-Topped Arugula Salad with Pomegranate Vinaigrette, Roasted Pear and Arugula Salad with Pomegranate-Chipotle Vinaigrette, and Roasted Pear & Arugula Salad with Pomegranate-Chipotle Vinaigrette.
instructions: In a small bowl combine the shallot, pomegranate molasses, vinegar, salt and pepper and whisk until the salt is dissolved.                                    Whisk in the olive oil and let vinaigrette stand at room temperature until salad is assembled.                                  Combine the arugula, romaine, pears and half of the pomegranate seeds in a large bowl.                                    Crumble half of the goat cheese over the ingredients in the bowl (this works best if the cheese is very cold).                                    Whisk the vinaigrette until uniform and add all but 2 tablespoons of it to the bowl.                                   Gently toss the salad with your hands or salad tongs, coating the ingredients well with the vinaigrette.  If the salad seems dry, add the vinaigrette in small increments until it is dressed to your liking.                                   Crumble the remaining cheese over the salad and sprinkle the remaining pomegranate seeds and the pistachios over the top.  Serve immediately.

steps.step: In a small bowl combine the shallot, pomegranate molasses, vinegar, salt and pepper and whisk until the salt is dissolved.
Whisk in the olive oil and let vinaigrette stand at room temperature until salad is assembled.
Combine the arugula, romaine, pears and half of the pomegranate seeds in a large bowl.
Crumble half of the goat cheese over the ingredients in the bowl (this works best if the cheese is very cold).
Whisk the vinaigrette until uniform and add all but 2 tablespoons of it to the bowl.

Gently toss the salad with your hands or salad tongs, coating the ingredients well with the vinaigrette.  If the salad seems dry, add the vinaigrette in small increments until it is dressed to your liking.
Crumble the remaining cheese over the salad and sprinkle the remaining pomegranate seeds and the pistachios over the top.
